subject: Math
title: Vertex Form of Quadratics
description: Understand and use vertex form f(x) = a(x - h)² + k

content.text: Vertex form makes it easy to identify the vertex and graph a parabola. It's especially useful for transformations and word problems.

content.heading: Vertex Form
content.text:
f(x) = a(x - h)² + k

• (h, k) is the vertex
• a determines width and direction
• If a > 0, opens upward
• If a < 0, opens downward
• |a| > 1: narrower, |a| < 1: wider

content.heading: Example 1
solution: Compare to f(x) = a(x - h)² + k
h = 3 (note: x - 3, so h is positive 3)

content.heading: Practice Problems
problems: For f(x) = 3(x - 1)² + 4, what is the vertex x-coordinate?
For f(x) = 3(x - 1)² + 4, what is the vertex y-coordinate?
Does f(x) = -2(x - 3)² + 1 open up or down?
Does f(x) = 4(x + 1)² - 5 open up or down?
